text_en: Mental Health Gap Action Programme (mhGAP) guideline for mental, neurological and substance use disorders PSY9. In adults presenting with a depressive episode in bipolar disorder, are medicines with antidepressant effects (adjunct to maintenance treatment) effective and safe? Recommendation (update): Fluoxetine, olanzapine, quetiapine, valproic acid (sodium valproate) or venlafaxine should be considered for adults with bipolar depression. If fluoxetine or venlafaxine are chosen, they should be co-administered with a mood stabilizer (namely quetiapine, olanzapine, carbamazepine, valproic acid [sodium valproate], lithium).
